column4: hi, umount keeps telling me that the device i want to umount is busy. what can I do?
you're not trying to unmount it while cd'd to it or a subdirectory?
no, and all apps but the console are closed
cd to it, 'find . -exec fuser {} \;'
if nothing shows there, you can always try a 'sudo umount -f *device*'
it gives me .:                   10861c 13978c 14770c
that'll do :)
what does that mean?
they're process id's using the path/files.  presumably one of them will be your shell, and the find
'ps -ef | grep *process ID*' to figure if it's safe to 'kill *ID*' them
it looks some things are still cd'd to it.  you should be safe to cd out of it, and kill those IDs.
flo       7491  6149  0 09:40 pts/3    00:00:00 xmms -p is hanging in there ;)
there you go then ;)
if xmms refuses to be killed, you can add -9 (kill immediately) ie. 'kill -9 7491'
yeah, thx. won't umount altough... chacking the IDs again
checking
remember to cd to ~ or something first
i did ;)
erk :/ probably some processes hanging in there
anyway, I will try again after a restart... thx a lot
np :)
